caption:
Ohhhhh haaayyyy @grovecollaborative 

#ad

Gurl, it's growing season so she's strutting into the lushness with some goodies from Grove to ensure her green gurls serve that new growth realness. So let's get into some helpful thangs for those lush lewks:

#1 A lil repotting rejuvenation, dahling
Get those hands a lil dirtay and spend some time inspecting the roots of your green gurls.  Check to see if the roots are root-bound (tangled mass of roots that allows little or no space for further growth), if this is the sish, she needs a larger planter and new soil. If the roots still have room, then keep her in the same planter, but still give a soil makeover, cuz that new soil will be rich with nutrients she can use to serve new growth realness all spring and summer long

#2 Spritz and a whipe down, gurl
Spraying your green gurls' with room temp water and gently wiping the leaves with a damp cloth is the perfect way to remove any dust or dirt that could find it’s way onto our green gurls’ foliage. This lil routine also rinses away any tragic pest or fungal spores. I tend to wipe the water from her leaves as foliage that remains wet for extended periods of time are prone to those tragic plant diseases that require moist environments to grow

#3  Nutrients be fundamental, kween
While I do fertilize my plants year-round (much less in the fall and winter), the arrival of spring means my green gurls are strutting into growing season, so that extra boost of nutrition on a more frequent basis be needed, hunny! Nitrogen, phosphorus, and potassium, are the primary nutrients in most houseplant fertilizers, along with secondary nutrients in smaller amounts (magnesium, calcium, sulfur, iron and boron)

#4 Mix your insecticide concoctions, hunny
Routine checks on your green gurls’ foliage is always helpful when trying to make sure you live that pest-free lifestyle, gurl. As a preventative measure I routinely spray mine with natural/non-chemical insecticide to ensure any microscopic pest that could be lurking around does not have a chance to spread.

Plagued by pesky seasonal sniffles? We know the feeling. Beat the Spring allergy blues with these 5 sneeze-busting cleaning strategies. 

1️⃣ Wipe surfaces with a damp cloth to trap dust, pollen, and other allergens.
2️⃣ Wash sheets and pillowcases weekly in hot water to remove dust mites and pollen.
3️⃣ Choose a vacuum with a particle-trapping HEPA filter. It will trap irritates instead of sending them airborne. 
4️⃣ Clean entryways to prevent pollen and dirt from being dragged into the house. 
5️⃣ If you've ever found yourself sneezing in the shower, mildew might be the culprit. Use a plant-based shower spray to stop it in its tracks.

Spring cleaning? It's so much more than clearing out a closet. Here are five other ways we're hitting refresh this season - mind, body, and soul. ⁣
⁣
🏠 Open a Window | Nothing beats a refreshing breeze on a lazy afternoon - or a long workday, for that matter! ⁣
⁣
🌺 Plant Flowers | The only thing better than time spent outdoors? A colorful, mood-boosting pay-off. ⁣
⁣
📱 Fine-Tune Your Feed | Unfollow social media accounts that make you feel small. Seriously - who needs 'em?⁣
⁣
☀️ Head Outside | Take a nature walk. Plan a hike. Let Mother Nature be your guide - a clear head is sure to follow. ⁣
⁣
👩🏽‍💻 Log Off | Set limits on screen time. You'll be surprised at the peace that less Instagram and binge-watching can bring!

Okay, so you're dreaming of a fully stocked (and well-organized) fridge. It's more attainable than you think - especially with a few reusable storage essentials from Grove Co. in your corner:⁣

💡 Create a system. Make like professional chefs and organize groceries based on the temperature they'll need to be cooked to. Store prepared foods and leftovers that don't need to be cooked on the top shelf, then work your way down, with raw items like chicken on the bottom.

🍶 Meal prep in style. Store dressings, jams, soups, and DIY salad mixes in Le Parfait's French-made glass jars. The durable, clear glass allows you to check on food's freshness in seconds flat. Plus, it won't stain or retain gross odors.⁣
